extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

AT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: adults with HCC in Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) stage B or C who did not receive any prior systemic therapy for the advanced or inoperable disease. Hepatic cirrhosis of any aetiology was not an exclusion criterion. Patients in BCLC stage B had to be ineligible for transarterial chemoembolization (TACE). Further inclusion criteria were Child-Pugh stage A and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group – Performance Status (ECOG-PS) score of 0 or 1.
Child-Pugh A patients with unresectable HCC
Child-Pugh A patients with unresectable HCC
patients with advanced HCC
patients with advanced HCC
hepatocellular carcinoma patients
Patients with HCC. Patients were not suitable candidates for surgical resection; participants were 18 years of age or older.
patients with advanced HCC
intermediate stage hepatocellular carcinoma (i.e. BCLCB stage; i.e. large, multinodular, Child-Pugh status A to B, and performance status 0)

PICOs.Population: adults with HCC in Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) stage B or C who did not receive any prior systemic therapy for the advanced or inoperable disease. Hepatic cirrhosis of any aetiology was not an exclusion criterion. Patients in BCLC stage B had to be ineligible for transarterial chemoembolization (TACE). Further inclusion criteria were Child-Pugh stage A and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group – Performance Status (ECOG-PS) score of 0 or 1.

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: treatment naive adult (aged ≥18 years) patients with advanced, unresectable or metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma
Adult patients with advanced HCC and adult patients with inoperable HCC.
patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

EN.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: adults with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) who have not had previous systemic treatment, who have Child-Pugh grade A liver impairment and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
